item.title: Best UI
item.content:encoded: Roblox Studio’s interface should be more like Blender’s.

item.title: Library performance
item.content:encoded:
Comparisons of performance between libraries are completely meaningless. The most optimal choice between two libraries is neither.

Consider the following question: is it being used on the hot path?

  • No: Then performance doesn’t matter.
  • Yes: Then it will be optimized away.

item.title: Language benchmarks
item.content:encoded: If a language benchmark requires sacrificing readability to achieve performance, then it isn’t an accurate measurement of the language.

item.title: Punishment
item.content:encoded: Surely we’re past punishing users for playing our games in ways we don’t like.

item.title: Immutable data
item.content:encoded: Hot Take: The table.clone-type immutable data libraries that people keep making are actually just table utility libraries with immutability add in for vague reasons. They don’t actually do any of the heavy lifting involved in making immutable data efficient.

item.title: Angry voice lines
item.content:encoded: Roblox allowing things like profanity will actually make the writing of angry characters worse.

item.title: DRY
item.content:encoded:
Keyword of Don’t Repeat Yourself is “Yourself”. Just because libraries have been written for trivial things doesn’t mean you should use any of them.

Most of these kinds of libraries are, at most, collections of snippets. They are short, complete, and are not worth an entire dependency. Just inline it.

item.title: Smashed statements
item.content:encoded: This morning I was flipping out over the line *(form++) = '%'; in a C codebase. Code shouldn’t be written this way anymore.

item.title: Plugin marketplace
item.content:encoded:
It’s fine to put pressure on Roblox for the plugin marketplace, but you have no business being angry about it. Its financial viability was questioned from the moment it was introduced.

It has been around two years with no action from Roblox. A very short time to coordinate a multitude of features across a variety of systems and teams while also juggling other priorities. Especially considering the happenings during those two particular years. My impression is that they’re working on it. Give the feature the time it deserves.

Moving to http://itch.io is an excellent way to apply pressure and get Roblox to reevaluate their priorities. I just think that being upset about it comes off as entitled.
